imgs.bullet2: Warm humid air flows inward, speeding up as it approaches the eyewall

imgs.bullet1: Rainbands typically are 3-30 miles wide and up tp 300 miles long
Rainbands produce heavy rainfall, as much as 25 cm (10 in.) per hour
Eye: Light winds, partly cloudy or clear skies. Average diameters 20-50 km
imgs.bullet2: Eyewall: Heaviest precipitation and strongest winds

imgs.bullet1: Air flowing out from the center of the storm (Outflow)
imgs.bullet2: Air sinking into storm center, warming and suppressing clouds. Winds are calm
